item.title: Identical
item.description: Dr. Ross Geller : You know what I think?… She's weird. It's because she's a twin. Rachel Green : Ross, she is not weird. She just likes her stuff to be one-of-a-kind. Dr. Ross Geller : You know what's not one-of-a-kind? A twin! -Friends (Ep: The One with the Apothecary Table) Fortunately, we don't live in a world described by Ross where identical twins are absolutely identical. “Identical twins” in precise bio-jargon are monozygotic individuals - one sperm fertilizes one egg, and the subsequent embryo forms two separate individuals with (nearly) identical genomes.

item.title: Into to R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can change the format of the text: italics - text bold - text You can even make titles: text text text text text text You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min.
